p: Neutrophils are the predominant cell found in the airways of infants with RSV bronchiolitis. Elevated levels of IL-8 are found in high concentrations in the nasal secretions of infected children and act as a neutrophil chemoattractant. Further evidence of cellular induced injury is seen in post-mortem examination where peribronchial lymphocyte infiltration with bronchial epithelial necrosis is typically present.
